In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **O** serves the following purposes:

- o represents an [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)"):

  - o [goblin](/wiki/Goblin "Goblin")
  - o [hobgoblin](/wiki/Hobgoblin "Hobgoblin")
  - o [orc](/wiki/Orc "Orc")
  - o [hill orc](/wiki/Hill_orc "Hill orc")
  - o [Mordor orc](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc")
  - o [Uruk-hai](/wiki/Uruk-hai "Uruk-hai")
  - o [orc shaman](/wiki/Orc_shaman "Orc shaman")
  - o [orc-captain](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain")

* O represents an [ogre](/wiki/Ogre_\(monster_class\) "Ogre (monster class)"):

  - O [ogre](/wiki/Ogre "Ogre")
  - O [ogre lord](/wiki/Ogre_lord "Ogre lord")
  - O [ogre king](/wiki/Ogre_king "Ogre king")

- Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [o]() to set game [options](/wiki/Options "Options").
- Press [o]() [open](/wiki/Open "Open") a door.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [2.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [2.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Historical uses

In hack121, orcs used the o glyph as in modern *NetHack*, while [oxidizers](/index.php?title=Oxidizer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Oxidizer (page does not exist)") used the O glyph; in Hack for PDP-11, and from Hack 1.0 to NetHack 2.3e, orcs instead used the O glyph, while [owlbears](/wiki/Owlbear "Owlbear") used the o glyph. In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the ogres were introduced and given the O glyph, while the various new and returning orcs were moved to the o glyph; owlbears were moved to ​H [giant humanoids](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid"), then subsequently reclassified as ​Y [apelike creatures](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature") in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces new creatures that use the o and O glyphs:

- o orc:

  - o [war orc](/wiki/War_orc "War orc")
  - o [great orc](/wiki/Great_orc "Great orc")
  - o [Grund the Orc King](/wiki/Grund_the_Orc_King "Grund the Orc King")
  - o [snow orc](/wiki/Snow_orc "Snow orc")
  - o [demon orc](/wiki/Demon_orc "Demon orc")

- O ogre:

  - O [ogre mage](/wiki/Ogre_mage "Ogre mage")
  - O [shadow ogre](/wiki/Shadow_ogre "Shadow ogre")

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), [ogres](/wiki/Ogre_\(starting_race\) "Ogre (starting race)") are a playable race, and both ogres and orcs are eligible races for the various [racial monsters](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") that appear in the dungeon, including [shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper"), [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") and [player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster").

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") introduces a new monster that uses the o glyph:

- o [deep orc](/wiki/Deep_orc "Deep orc")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") introduces several new monsters that use the o and O glyphs:

- o orc:

  - o [Uruk-captain](/wiki/Uruk-captain "Uruk-captain")
  - o [Mordor orc elite](/wiki/Mordor_orc_elite "Mordor orc elite")
  - o [Mordor shaman](/wiki/Mordor_shaman "Mordor shaman")
  - o [Mordor marshal](/wiki/Mordor_marshal "Mordor marshal")
  - o [Angband orc](/wiki/Angband_orc "Angband orc")
  - o [orc of the ages of stars](/wiki/Orc_of_the_ages_of_stars "Orc of the ages of stars")
  - o [orc warchief](/wiki/Orc_warchief "Orc warchief")
  - o [Bolg](/wiki/Bolg "Bolg")
  - o [high shaman](/wiki/High_shaman "High shaman")
  - o [orc warrior](/wiki/Orc_warrior "Orc warrior")

- O ogre:

  - O [ogre mage](/wiki/Ogre_mage "Ogre mage")
  - O [ogre emperor](/wiki/Ogre_emperor "Ogre emperor")
  - O [siege ogre](/wiki/Siege_ogre "Siege ogre")

### SlashTHEM

- *Main article: [Ogre (starting race)](/wiki/Ogre_\(starting_race\) "Ogre (starting race)")*

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the new monsters added in SLASH'EM that use the o and O glyphs, and also features the ogre as a playable race (formerly called the [ogro](/wiki/Ogro "Ogro")).

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter O serves the following purposes:

  • o represents an orc:
    • o goblin
    • o hobgoblin
    • o orc
    • o hill orc
    • o Mordor orc
    • o Uruk-hai
    • o orc shaman
    • o orc-captain
  • O represents an ogre:
    • O ogre
    • O ogre lord
    • O ogre king
  • Press shift + o to set game options.
  • Press o open a door.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 GruntHack
    • 2.3 UnNetHack
    • 2.4 dNetHack
    • 2.5 SlashTHEM

Historical uses

In hack121, orcs used the o glyph as in modern NetHack, while oxidizers used the O glyph; in Hack for PDP-11, and from Hack 1.0 to NetHack 2.3e, orcs instead used the O glyph, while owlbears used the o glyph. In NetHack 3.0.0, the ogres were introduced and given the O glyph, while the various new and returning orcs were moved to the o glyph; owlbears were moved to ​H giant humanoids, then subsequently reclassified as ​Y apelike creatures in NetHack 3.1.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces new creatures that use the o and O glyphs:

  • o orc:
    • o war orc
    • o great orc
    • o Grund the Orc King
    • o snow orc
    • o demon orc
  • O ogre:
    • O ogre mage
    • O shadow ogre

GruntHack

In GruntHack, ogres are a playable race, and both ogres and orcs are eligible races for the various racial monsters that appear in the dungeon, including shopkeepers, soldiers and player monsters.

UnNetHack

UnNetHack introduces a new monster that uses the o glyph:

  • o deep orc

dNetHack

dNetHack introduces several new monsters that use the o and O glyphs:

  • o orc:
    • o Uruk-captain
    • o Mordor orc elite
    • o Mordor shaman
    • o Mordor marshal
    • o Angband orc
    • o orc of the ages of stars
    • o orc warchief
    • o Bolg
    • o high shaman
    • o orc warrior
  • O ogre:
    • O ogre mage
    • O ogre emperor
    • O siege ogre

SlashTHEM

Main article: Ogre (starting race)

SlashTHEM retains the new monsters added in SLASH'EM that use the o and O glyphs, and also features the ogre as a playable race (formerly called the ogro).
